clinical_study.brief_title: Acupuncture for Functional Dyspepsia: a Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) Study
clinical_study.official_title: Acupuncture for Functional Dyspepsia: a Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

clinical_study.source: Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: He-Mu-point combination（ST36 and CV12） is one of the most commonly used acupoints combination with synergistic effect for functional dyspepsia(FD). The investigators design the trial to identify the efficacy and explore the central integrated mechanism of puncturing at He-Mu-point combination on FD with functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI).

detailed_description.textblock: 105 participants with functional dyspepsia will be allocated into three groups: Low-He point group, Mu point group and He-Mu-point combination group.Every participant will receive 20 sessions of manual acupuncture treatment during 4 weeks. Clinical evaluations will be assessed three times, as measured after randomization, 10 and 20 sessions of treatment.The fMRI scans will be conducted twice, after randomization and treatment completion.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of adverse events during the 4 weeks

arm_group.description: Zusanli (ST36, the Low-He point of stomach) is the most important point for gastrointestinal disorder, including functional dyspepsia. Everyone in the group will be punctured at unilateral Zusanli.
Zhongwan (CV12, the Mu point of stomach) is also good at regulating gastric function. Everyone in the group will be punctured at Zhongwan.

In traditional Chinese acupuncture theory，synergistic effect can be produced by acupoints combination and the He-Mu-point combination is a classical acupoints combination formula for gastrointestinal diseases. Everyone in the group will be punctured at unilateral Zusanli and Zhongwan.

intervention.description: Manual acupuncture treatment will be conducted. thirty minutes duration every time, five times per week for one course, a total four courses.
